Well, I think Darwin would realize that

What has evolved, of course, is our

how evolution could not get swamped by

Um now we have a very clear

uh uh more than a half a century after
he published the origin of
species, William Bateson, the great
geneticist, early 20th century

was
inconceivable that what he called
nuclear chromatin could be the material
basis for heredity. Well, that's DNA.
and he just couldn't imagine how it
could be cuz to him that seemed
homogeneous under all known tests. It
seemed to be just too simple. Well, now
of course we know that that nuclear
chromatin
has in the case of human beings a double
helix molecule with three billion base
pairs in it and it's copied into every
single cell in our body. That's
stunning. He couldn't imagine that.
Well, there's simplistic ways of doing

and
let's push ahead firmly and uh avoid the
huge
oversimplifications and settle for the
